text: God lives in Belarus!
author: Uladzimir Karatkevich

text: The one who loves is immortal!
author: Uladzimir Karatkevich

text: Who has forgotten his ancestors - loses himself, Who has forgotten his language - has lost everything.
author: Uladzimir Karatkevich

text: Where is my land? Where people will never be slaves!
author: Uladzimir Karatkevich

text: The Lord bows down to all, but He does not listen to anyone in spirit.
author: Nina Matyash

text: Although, it is true, bread is eaten from a fishing rod, but not everyone and not everywhere.
author: Yakub Kolas

text: A poet - he burns like a painful bump on the forehead of an offended people.
author: Grigor Baradulin

text: Every time humanity is closer to happiness at the height of our graves.
author: Kastus Kalinovsky

text: We must be slaves to laws in order to be able to enjoy freedom.
author: Leu Sapega

text: Every nation has at least one work of genius, and that work is language.
author: Ales Razanov

text: There will be no grief, because there was nothing better.
author: Uladzimir Nyaklyaev

text: As always in war, the main price is blood, and the one who is least guilty pays.
author: Vasyl Bykau

text: It's good to be on the road you choose for yourself.
author: Yakub Kolas

text: No one has yet managed to close the memory window.
author: Uladzimir Arlou

text: Each lived day rejects what is and brings closer to what will be.
author: Kuzma Chorny

text: Not the people for the government, but the government for the people.
author: Kastus Kalinovsky

text: The truth is in the story â€“ the function is unambiguous, lessons are learned from it. No lessons can be learned from lies, except new lies.
author: Vasyl Bykau

text: At the root of every fear lies our ignorance, our darkness.
author: Yakub Kolas

text: All roads are endless, except the one leading to the cemetery.
author: Maxim Tank

text: Children are God's smile.
author: Uladzimir Karatkevich
